name: Sweet Hunter's Smile
description: As the homid Gift: Persuasion. This Gift allows a homid to become more persuasive when dealing with others, in such a way that his statements and arguments are imbued with added meaning or credibility. An ancestor-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Eye of the Hunter
description: As the Red Talon Gift. Wolves can sense which animal from a herd is sick or weak and therefore the easiest prey. This Gift allows the Ajaba to pick out the weakest member of a group at a glance. A wolf-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Feral Grin
description: With a snarl or glare, the Ajaba forces her opponent to back down, unnerved. A hyena-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Gift of Terror
description: As the Red Talon Gift: Wolf at the Door. The Ajaba can induce a terrible dread and respect for the wilderness in their victims, making them afraid to venture out. Any predator spirit can teach this Gift.

name: Infectious Laughter
description: As the Ragabash Gift. When the Ajaba laughs, those around her are compelled to follow along, forgetting their grievances. A coyote- or hyena-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Primal Anger
description: As the metis Gift. The Ajaba learns to focus the anger within her heart and use it to increase her Rage. The spirits of ancient metis teach this Gift.

name: Sense Prey
description: As the lupus Gift. The Gift lets Ajaba locate enough prey to feed a pack. In the urban environment, this Gift guides them to prey within the city. A wolf-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Beat of the Heart-Drum
description: As the Wendigo Gift. The Ajaba becomes an inescapable hunter, drawn ever onward by the beat of their prey's heart until that heart grows still. A spirit servant of Great Wendigo teaches this Gift.

name: Finishing Blow
description: A merely wounded enemy is an enemy that can still fight; dead, they can do no more harm. This Gift, taught by a lion-spirit, helps the Ajaba finish their kills.

name: Lightning Reflexes
description: As the Get of Fenris Gift. The Ajaba can effortlessly switch from offense to defense as the needs of battle demand. A mongoose-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Pack Tactics
description: As the Ahroun Gift. By taking the lead and coordinating pack actions, the Ajaba gifts all packmates with great competence in battle. A wolf-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Razor Claws
description: As the Ahroun Gift. By raking their claws over stone, steel, or another hard surface, the Ajaba hones them to razor sharpness. Either a cat- or bear-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Resist Pain
description: As the Philodox Gift. Through force of will, the Ajaba is able to ignore the pain of their wounds and continue acting normally. A bear-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Sense Wyrm
description: As the metis Gift. The Ajaba can sense manifestations of the Wyrm in the nearby area. Any spirit of Gaia may teach this Gift.

name: Beast Speech
description: As the Galliard Gift. The Ajaba with this Gift may communicate with any animals from fish to mammals. Any spirit of nature can teach this Gift.

name: Burning the Vision
description: The Midnight can etch a moment into another's memory, ensuring that they can never forget so much as a single detail of what they see or hear. This Gift, taught by a servant of Helios, is often used at the scenes of terrible atrocities against Gaia.

name: Mindspeak
description: As the Galliard Gift. By invoking the power of waking dreams, the Ajaba can place any chosen characters into silent communion. A Chimerling teaches this Gift.

name: Mother's Touch
description: As the Theurge Gift. The Ajaba is able to heal the wounds of any living creature, aggravated or otherwise, simply by laying hands over the afflicted area. A bear- or unicorn-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Perfect Recall
description: As the Galliard Gift. This Gift accentuates the Ajaba's memory capacity, allowing them to remember any detail from their entire life. Any Weaver-spirit can teach this Gift.

name: Tears of the Heavens
description: Raising their arms and reciting a spontaneous poem, the Ajaba calls down the rain. A sky-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Blur of the Milky Eye
description: As the Ragabash Gift. The Ajaba's form becomes a shimmering blur, allowing them to pass unnoticed among others. A chameleon-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Fatal Flaw
description: As the Shadow Lord Gift. The Ajaba can discern a target's weakness, granting an advantage in combat. A Stormcrow teaches this Gift.

name: Laughter in the Night
description: Like any good hyena, the Ajaba is much more dangerous once the sun goes down — and far bolder in taking prey. A night-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Open Seal
description: As the Ragabash Gift. With this Gift, the Ajaba can open nearly any sort of closed or locked physical device. A raccoon-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Crushing Jaws
description: Only death can loose the Ajaba's jaws. By using this Gift together as a group, several Ajaba can pull apart even the mightiest opponent. A hyena-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Curse of Hatred
description: As the metis Gift. The Ajaba may verbalize the hatred in her heart, disheartening opponents with the intensity of her emotion. A spirit of hate teaches this Gift.

name: Gender Shift
description: As the Black Fury Gift: Man's Skin. The Ajaba can effectively change gender in the eyes of onlookers. An ancestor-spirit or a seahorse-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Odious Aroma
description: As the Bone Gnawer Gift. The Ajaba can amplify their body odor to the point that it debilitates any who can smell it. A stinkbug-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Pulse of the Prey
description: As the Ragabash Gift. If they know anything about their prey, the Ajaba can track it down as rapidly as they can travel. This unerring sense of direction operates anywhere. A wolf- or dog-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Bless the Rains
description: The Ajaba composes words of thanks to the rain falling around them, complimenting it for sharing its bounty with the dry Earth. The rains respond with generosity. An ancestor-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Distractions
description: As the Galliard Gift. The Ajaba can make annoying yips, yelps and howls to divert the attention of their target. A coyote-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Dreamspeak
description: As the Galliard Gift. The Ajaba can enter another's dream and thereby affect the course of that dream. A Chimerling teaches this Gift.

name: Scavenge
description: The Ajaba may safely consume and digest any physical object they can get into their mouth, from carrion to pistols to toxic waste: their jaws can chew it, and their stomach can process it. A goat-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Shadows of the Serengeti
description: As the Ajaba sings a song of their fallen Kin, their shadows rise from the dust of the earth to lend their strength to their cause. A night-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Clan Loyalty
description: As the Bone Gnawer Gift: Friend in Need. The Ajaba may risk all, even their own life, to aid a packmate or tribemate. A dog-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Clenched Jaw
description: As the Ahroun Gift. The Ajaba can bite down with such power that their grip won't loosen until they choose to do so; even in death, their jaws bite down. A wolf- or hyena-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Gift of the Skunk
description: As the Bone Gnawer Gift. With this Gift, the Ajaba can swell their musk glands, allowing them to spray musk like a skunk. It is taught by a skunk-spirit.

name: Laugh of the Hyena
description: As the Bone Gnawer Gift. The Ajaba can resist any attempt to command, cajole, force, or demand them to do something they don't want to do through mocking laughter. A Hyena-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Laughter of the Soul
description: The Ajaba's barking chuckle worms into enemies' minds, becoming a harbinger of terror and madness. Fear-spirits teach this Gift.

name: Calling the Eshu
description: As the Fianna Gift: Faerie Kin. Ajaba use this Gift to summon taletelling spirits to enlighten their packs. A dream-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Exorcism
description: As the Theurge Gift. This is the Gift of ejecting spirits from places or objects, whether they are there voluntarily or are bound there. Any Incarna avatar can teach this Gift.

name: Song of Heroes
description: As the Galliard Gift. Reciting a tale of ancient heroism, the Ajaba conjures up the spirit of fallen heroes and infuses those listening with some portion of their power. An ancestor-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Wisdom of the Ancient Ways
description: As the Philodox Gift. All Ajaba have an innate connection to their ancestors, a form of racial unconscious accessible through intense meditation. An ancestor-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Culling the Weak
description: The Ajaba use the strength Gaia granted them to mark the weak — and then allow their enemies' very weakness to prepare them for the slaughter. This Gift is taught by a vulture-spirit.

name: Gnaw
description: As the lupus Gift. The Ajaba's jaws strengthen to the point that they can chew through just about anything, given enough time. A wolf-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Gorge
description: As the Red Talon Gift. The Ajaba can store extra Rage, Gnosis or Willpower against times of need. A wolf-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Bitter Tears
description: Standing in the pouring rain, the Ajaba composes a spontaneous poem expressing their sorrow at Gaia's fallen state; the intensity of the rain redoubles, and it carries some measure of their sadness. An ancestor-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Gift of Dreams
description: As the Galliard Gift. The Ajaba crafts a dream, then breathes it into a sleeping individual. A Lune teaches this Gift.

name: Phantasm
description: As the Fianna Gift. The Ajaba creates an unmoving illusion that contains visual, auditory, olfactory and even tactile elements. A grain-spirit — the so-called 'spirit of spirits' — teaches this gift.

name: Becoming the Night Jester
description: Though this Gift offers no power during the day, by night the Dusk's Crocas form takes on an aspect of ancient nocturnal terror — a primal, red-eyed, and black-furred hyena the size of a polar bear. Hyena herself teaches this Gift.

name: Echoes of the Asamando
description: Powerful Ajaba of the Dusk learn dark roads to victory, gleaning wisdom from voices most would quail to hear. This Gift, taught by an ancestor-spirit, allows the Ajaba to speak and be heard by the dead — and to hear their voices in return.

name: Open Wounds
description: As the Shadow Lord Gift. The Ajaba may cause the next wound they inflict to bleed profusely, weakening the target further. A pain-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Strength of Kilimanjaro
description: As the Get of Fenris Gift: Endurance of Heimdall. This powerful Gift grants the Ajaba great endurance and hardiness for a time. This Gift is taught by a Boar-spirit.

name: Survivor
description: As the Bone Gnawer Gift. This Gift confers temporary immunity to many environmental factors. The Ajaba has no need of food, water or sleep, and is immune to natural diseases and poisons.

name: Withering Stare
description: As the general Bastet Gift. This Gift lets an Ajaba kill with a glance, causing victims to die in agonized convulsions.

name: Fabric of the Mind
description: As the Galliard Gift. The highest-ranked Ajaba can bring the products of their imagination to very solid life, crafting creatures from the spiritual essence of dreams. Chimerlings teach this Gift.

name: Rain of Doom
description: Standing in the rain, the Ajaba points to a man-made object or building and spits insults and curses at it, expressing their rage and disdain. The rain acts as acid when it strikes the structure. A pain-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Reach the Umbra
description: As the Silent Strider Gift. The Ajaba may step into and out of the Umbra at will, without need of a reflective surface or even any effort at all. An owl-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Shadow Pack
description: As the Shadow Lord Gift. The Ajaba summons up shadowy duplicates of themselves to stand by them in battle. A night-spirit teaches this Gift.
